IRS990.MissionDesc: SUDBURY VALLEY TRUSTEES, INC. ("THE ORGANIZATION") WORKS TO PROTECT NATURAL AREAS AND FARMLAND FOR WILDLIFE AND PEOPLE IN THE 36 COMMUNITIES THAT SURROUND THE SUDBURY, ASSABET, AND CONCORD RIVERS. THE ORGANIZATION CARES FOR SOME OF THE REGION'S MOST IMPORTANT FORESTS, WETLANDS, AND GRASSLANDS NATURAL AREAS THAT SUPPORT WILDLIFE HABITAT, WORKING FARMS, AND RECREATIONAL TRAILS. THE ORGANIZATION CARES FOR MORE THAN 5,700 ACRES ON 94 RESERVATIONS AND 99 CONSERVATION RESTRICTIONS AND PROTECTS MORE THAN 70 MILES OF TRAILS.
IRS990.Desc: AS A REGIONAL NONPROFIT LAND TRUST, THE ORGANIZATION COLLABORATES WITH INDIVIDUAL LANDOWNERS, LOCAL LAND TRUSTS, AND MUNICIPAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL AGENCIES TO PROTECT LAND FOR WILDLIFE HABITAT, PASSIVE RECREATION, AGRICULTURE, AND FORESTRY. IN SOME CASES, THE ORGANIZATION ACQUIRES PROPERTY TO OWN AND MANAGE AS A RESERVATION, AND IN OTHER CASES THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS CONSERVATION LAND OWNED BY OTHERS. IN EITHER SITUATION, THE ORGANIZATION ENSURES THAT NO UNAPPROVED DEVELOPMENT OR OTHER ACTIVITY TAKES PLACE ON THE LAND.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE STEWARDSHIP PROGRAM IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MANAGEMENT OF THE RESERVATIONS THAT THE ORGANIZATION OWNS AND FOR THE MONITORING AND OVERSIGHT OF CONSERVATION RESTRICTIONS. THE STEWARDSHIP PROGRAM INCLUDES ECOSYSTEM AND HABITAT PROTECTION, MAINTENANCE OF VIEWS, ACCESS, AND TRAILS, PROTECTION OF THE LEGACY OF THE PROPERTIES, AND COORDINATION OF THE STEWARDSHIP VOLUNTEERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION PARTNERS WITH MUNICIPAL BOARDS AND COMMITTEES, LOCAL LAND TRUSTS, AND STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES TO SUPPORT ONE ANOTHER'S CONSERVATION GOALS AND TO POOL RESOURCES TO ENABLE CONSERVATION. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION WORKS WITH LANDOWNERS WHO ARE INTERESTED IN MAKING LONG-TERM CONSERVATION PLANS FOR THEIR LAND AND PARTICIPATES IN NON-PARTISAN WORK TO ADVOCATE FOR POLICIES AND FUNDING THAT DIRECTLY ADVANCE THE LAND PROTECTION AND STEWARDSHIP OF NATURAL AREAS AROUND THE SUDBURY, ASSABET, AND CONCORD RIVERS, AS WELL AS IN MASSACHUSETTS IN GENERAL.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE POLICY REGARDING CONSERVATION EASEMENTS STATES STAFF WILL CONDUCT ANNUAL MONITORING OF CONSERVATION EASEMENTS, ENCOURAGING LANDOWNERS TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE SITE VISITS AND MAINTAINING GOOD RELATIONS WITH THEM. IN CASES OF VIOLATION, SUDBURY VALLEY TRUSTEES WILL ASSESS THE PROBLEM, WORK IN A TIMELY MANNER TO PROTECT THE VALUES OF THE CONSERVATION EASEMENT AND FIND A RESOLUTION THAT FITS THE SPECIFIC SITUATION.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS ACQUIRED AND HOLDS A NUMBER OF CONSERVATION EASEMENTS, EACH REPRESENTING A LEGAL INTEREST IN LAND OWNED BY ANOTHER PERSON OR ENTITY. CONSERVATION EASEMENTS REPRESENT RESTRICTIONS ON THE USE, SUBDIVISION AND/OR DEVELOPMENT OF CERTAIN PARCELS. THE EASEMENTS GRANT THE ORGANIZATION THE RIGHT TO USE, CONTROL, AND/OR PROTECT LAND FOR CONSERVATION PURPOSES. BECAUSE OF THE UNIQUE NATURE OF THESE ASSETS, THE IMPRACTICALITY OF OBTAINING CONSISTENT AND RELIABLE ESTIMATES OF THE VALUES ASSOCIATED WITH THESE INTERESTS, AND CONSISTENT WITH THE PRACTICES FOLLOWED BY MANY ENVIRONMENTAL LAND TRUSTS, THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS DO NOT INCLUDE ANY AMOUNTS FOR THESE PROPERTY INTERESTS. PURCHASED EASEMENTS ARE RECOGNIZED AS A PROGRAM EXPENSE UPON ACQUISITION BASE ON THE ACQUISITION COST OF THE EASEMENT.
INCOME FROM THE RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT IS USED PRIMARILY FOR THE STEWARDSHIP OF CONSERVATION LAND OF THE ORGANIZATION.

BELOW IS AN EXCERPT FROM NOTE 2 TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: THE ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE ("IRS") AS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE ("IRC") SECTION 501(A) AS AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN IRC SECTION 501(C)(3), QUALIFIES FOR CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION DEDUCTIONS, AND HAS BEEN DETERMINED NOT TO BE A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE ORGANIZATION IS ANNUALLY REQUIRED TO FILE A RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX (FORM 990) WITH THE IRS. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION IS SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX ON NET INCOME THAT IS DERIVED FROM BUSINESS ACTIVITIES THAT ARE UNRELATED TO ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE. THE ORGANIZATION ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAIN TAX PROVISIONS UNDER FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD ("FASB") ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION ("ASC") 740, INCOME TAXES, WHICH PROVIDES A FRAMEWORK FOR HOW ENTITIES SHOULD RECOGNIZE, MEASURE, PRESENT, AND DISCLOSE UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS IN THEIR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION MAY RECOGNIZE THE TAX BENEFIT FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION ONLY IF IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED ON EXAMINATION BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES, BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. MANAGEMENT HAS REVIEWED THE ORGANIZATION'S REPORTING AND BELIEVES THEY HAVE NOT TAKEN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE DETERMINED TO BE INCORRECT BY THE IRS AND, THEREFORE, NO ADJUSTMENTS OR DISCLOSURES ARE REQUIRED. THE ORGANIZATION IS SUBJECT TO ROUTINE AUDITS BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS; HOWEVER, THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO AUDITS FOR ANY TAX PERIODS PENDING OR IN PROGRESS.
COST OF GOODS SOLD -20,895. FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES 10,870.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 20,895. FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES -10,870.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: PURCHASE OF AN AGRICULTURAL PRESERVATION RESTRICTION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SUDBURY VALLEY TRUSTEES HAS STAFF MEMBER WHO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MANAGING GRANTS. THEY MANAGE THE APPLICATION PROCESS AS WELL AS THE DEADLINES, BUDGETING, TRACKING AND REPORTING THAT ARE REQUIRED.

THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S PERFORMANCE REVIEW, COMPENSATION AND BONUS IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROCESS DESCRIBED IN THE SCHEDULE O NOTE FOR FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15. THE BONUS IS DISCRETIONARY.
THE AMOUNT IN COLUMN B REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS MEMBERS WHO VOTE TO ELECT OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS AT THE ANNUAL MEETING AND THEY VOTE ON ANY BY-LAW CHANGES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS VOTE TO ELECT OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS AT THE ANNUAL MEETING AND THEY VOTE ON ANY BY-LAW CHANGES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNANCE DECISIONS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE SUBJECT TO A VOTE FOR APPROVAL BY MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE TREASURER AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WHO REVIEW IT WITH THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND DISCLOSES ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST BY SIGNING A FORM TO THAT EFFECT. BOARD MEMBERS MUST RECUSE IF A VOTE IS TO BE TAKEN ON AN ISSUE IN WHICH THE MEMBER HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS EVALUATED ANNUALLY BASED ON ACHIEVEMENT OF GOALS AGREED UPON BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TAKES INTO CONSIDERATION COMPENSATION PACKAGES OF EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS FOR COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS WHICH VOTES ON THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION PACKAGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
